when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings
example: プレゼントをありがとう！(Purezento o arigatou!) - Thank you for the gift!

when_to_say: Used as a greeting during the daytime
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (Konnichiwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when parting with someone formally
example: さようなら、また会いましょう (Sayounara, mata aimashou) - Goodbye, see you again.

when_to_say: Used when apologizing or getting someone's attention
example: すみません、道に迷いました。 (Sumimasen, michi ni mayoimashita) - Excuse me, I got lost.

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning
example: おはようございます！(Ohayou gozaimasu!) - Good morning!

when_to_say: Used to describe something enjoyable
example: このゲームは楽しいです！(Kono geemu wa tanoshii desu!) - This game is fun!

when_to_say: Used to inquire about someone's well-being
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (Konnichiwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to describe something costly or tall
example: この靴は高いです。(Kono kutsu wa takai desu.) - These shoes are expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe long distances
example: 駅は遠いですか？ (Eki wa tooi desu ka?) - Is the station far?

when_to_say: Used to describe short distances
example: 学校は近いです。(Gakkou wa chikai desu.) - The school is close.

when_to_say: Used to describe something or someone stunning
example: その花は美しい。(Sono hana wa utsukushii.) - That flower is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather
example: 今日は寒いですね。(Kyou wa samui desu ne.) - It's cold today, isn't it?

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather or conditions
example: 今日は暑いです。(Kyou wa atsui desu.) - It's hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is blue in color
example: 空は青いです。(Sora wa aoi desu.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is red in color
example: リンゴは赤いです。(Ringo wa akai desu.) - The apple is red.

when_to_say: Used when going to a location
example: 学校に行きます。(Gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when coming to a location
example: 友達が来ます。(Tomodachi ga kimasu.) - A friend is coming.

when_to_say: Used when referring to eating
example: パンを食べます。(Pan o tabemasu.) - I eat bread.

when_to_say: Used when referring to drinking
example: 水を飲みます。(Mizu o nomimasu.) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used when referring to looking at something
example: 映画を見ます。(Eiga o mimasu.) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when referring to listening or asking
example: 音楽を聞きます。(Ongaku o kikimasu.) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to speaking or talking
example: 日本語を話します。(Nihongo o hanashimasu.) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing
example: 手紙を書きます。(Tegami o kakimasu.) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when referring to reading
example: 本を読みます。(Hon o yomimasu.) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sitting down
example: 椅子に座ります。(Isu ni suwarimasu.) - I sit on a chair.

when_to_say: Used when referring to standing up
example: 彼は立ちます。(Kare wa tachimasu.) - He stands up.

when_to_say: Used when referring to walking
example: 公園を歩きます。(Kouen o arukimasu.) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used when referring to running
example: 彼は走ります。(Kare wa hashirimasu.) - He runs.

when_to_say: Used when referring to laughing or smiling
example: 彼女は笑います。(Kanojo wa waraimasu.) - She laughs.

when_to_say: Used when referring to crying
example: 赤ちゃんが泣きます。(Akachan ga nakimasu.) - The baby cries.

when_to_say: Used when referring to thinking or considering
example: それについて考えます。(Sore ni tsuite kangaemasu.) - I think about it.

when_to_say: Used when referring to studying
example: 日本語を勉強します。(Nihongo o benkyou shimasu.) - I study Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to forgetting something
example: 宿題を忘れました。(Shukudai o wasuremashita.) - I forgot my homework.

when_to_say: Used when referring to remembering something
example: この単語を覚えます。(Kono tango o oboemasu.) - I remember this word.

when_to_say: Used when referring to returning home
example: 家に帰ります。(Ie ni kaerimasu.) - I return home.

when_to_say: Used when referring to waking up in the morning
example: 毎朝7時に起きます。(Maiasa shichiji ni okimasu.) - I wake up at 7 AM every morning.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sleeping or going to bed
example: 夜10時に寝ます。(Yoru juujini nemasu.) - I go to bed at 10 PM.

when_to_say: Used when referring to swimming
example: プールで泳ぎます。(Puuru de oyogimasu.) - I swim in the pool.

when_to_say: Used when referring to searching for something
example: 鍵を探しています。(Kagi o sagashiteimasu.) - I am searching for the key.

when_to_say: Used when referring to finding something
example: 答えを見つけました。(Kotae o mitsukemashita.) - I found the answer.

when_to_say: Used when referring to riding vehicles
example: バスに乗ります。(Basu ni norimasu.) - I ride the bus.

when_to_say: Used when referring to getting off vehicles
example: 駅で降ります。(Eki de orimasu.) - I get off at the station.

when_to_say: Used when referring to purchasing something
example: 本を買います。(Hon o kaimasu.) - I buy a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to selling something
example: 果物を売ります。(Kudamono o urimasu.) - I sell fruits.

when_to_say: Used when referring to repairing something
example: 自転車を直します。(Jitensha o naoshimasu.) - I fix the bicycle.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sending something
example: 手紙を送ります。(Tegami o okurimasu.) - I send a letter.

when_to_say: Used when referring to explaining something
example: 課題を説明します。(Kadai o setsumei shimasu.) - I explain the task.

when_to_say: Used when recommending something
example: この本を勧めます。(Kono hon o susumemasu.) - I recommend this book.

when_to_say: Used when encouraging effort
example: 試験を頑張ります。(Shiken o ganbarimasu.) - I do my best for the exam.

when_to_say: Used when referring to dancing
example: 彼女は踊ります。(Kanojo wa odorimasu.) - She dances.

when_to_say: Used when referring to singing
example: 彼は歌います。(Kare wa utaimasu.) - He sings.

when_to_say: Used when referring to running
example: 彼女は速く走ります。(Kanojo wa hayaku hashirimasu.) - She runs fast.

when_to_say: Used when referring to teaching
example: 日本語を教えます。(Nihongo o oshiemasu.) - I teach Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to learning
example: 私は日本語を学びます。(Watashi wa Nihongo o manabimasu.) - I learn Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to waiting
example: 駅で待っています。(Eki de matteimasu.) - I am waiting at the station.

when_to_say: Used when referring to making or creating something
example: 料理を作ります。(Ryouri o tsukurimasu.) - I make food.

when_to_say: Used when referring to playing or having fun
example: 公園で遊びます。(Kouen de asobimasu.) - I play at the park.

when_to_say: Refers to studying
example: 私は日本語の勉強をしています。(Watashi wa Nihongo no benkyou o shiteimasu.) - I am studying Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to resting or taking a break
example: 今日は休みです。(Kyou wa yasumi desu.) - I am resting today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something necessary
example: これは必要です。(Kore wa hitsuyou desu.) - This is necessary.

when_to_say: Used when referring to cooking or food preparation
example: 私は料理が得意です。(Watashi wa ryouri ga tokui desu.) - I am good at cooking.

when_to_say: Used when referring to oneself
example: 自分でやります。(Jibun de yarimasu.) - I will do it myself.

when_to_say: Used to describe something early or fast
example: 彼は早く走ります。(Kare wa hayaku hashirimasu.) - He runs fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe something slow or late
example: 電車が遅いです。(Densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is late.

when_to_say: Used when referring to movement or action
example: 車が動きません。(Kuruma ga ugokimasen.) - The car is not moving.

when_to_say: Used when entering a place
example: 部屋に入ります。(Heya ni hairimasu.) - I enter the room.

when_to_say: Used when leaving or going out
example: 家を出ます。(Ie o demasu.) - I leave the house.

when_to_say: Used when verifying or checking something
example: 内容を確認します。(Naiyou o kakunin shimasu.) - I will confirm the details.

when_to_say: Used when making decisions
example: 来週の予定を決めます。(Raishuu no yotei o kimemasu.) - I will decide next week's schedule.

when_to_say: Used when referring to something being sold out
example: その商品は売れました。(Sono shouhin wa uremashita.) - The product sold out.

when_to_say: Used when putting something inside a container
example: バッグに本を入れます。(Baggu ni hon o iremasu.) - I put the book in the bag.

when_to_say: Used when taking something out of a container
example: 財布からお金を出します。(Saifu kara okane o dashimasu.) - I take money out of my wallet.

when_to_say: Used when holding something
example: ペンを持っています。(Pen o motteimasu.) - I am holding a pen.

when_to_say: Used when handing something to someone
example: 本を渡します。(Hon o watashimasu.) - I hand over the book.

when_to_say: Used when drawing or sketching
example: 絵を描きます。(E o kakimasu.) - I draw a picture.

when_to_say: Used when taking a photo or video
example: 写真を撮ります。(Shashin o torimasu.) - I take a picture.

when_to_say: Used when referring to knowledge
example: 私はそれを知っています。(Watashi wa sore o shitteimasu.) - I know that.

when_to_say: Used when expressing thoughts or opinions
example: 私はそう思います。(Watashi wa sou omoimasu.) - I think so.

when_to_say: Used when referring to belief or trust
example: 私はあなたを信じています。(Watashi wa anata o shinjiteimasu.) - I believe in you.

when_to_say: Used when waiting for something or someone
example: 駅で待っています。(Eki de matteimasu.) - I am waiting at the station.

when_to_say: Used when referring to walking
example: 公園を歩きます。(Kouen o arukimasu.) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used when recommending something
example: この本を勧めます。(Kono hon o susumemasu.) - I recommend this book.

when_to_say: Used when something is required or necessary
example: これが必要です。(Kore ga hitsuyou desu.) - This is necessary.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is busy
example: 今日は忙しいです。(Kyou wa isogashii desu.) - I am busy today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something fun or enjoyable
example: このゲームは楽しいです。(Kono geemu wa tanoshii desu.) - This game is fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe something difficult
example: この問題は難しいです。(Kono mondai wa muzukashii desu.) - This problem is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe something simple or easy
example: このテストは簡単です。(Kono tesuto wa kantan desu.) - This test is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something positive or good
example: 良い天気ですね。(Yoi tenki desu ne.) - The weather is good, isn't it?

when_to_say: Used to describe something negative or bad
example: 今日は悪い天気です。(Kyou wa warui tenki desu.) - The weather is bad today.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed
example: 彼は速いです。(Kare wa hayai desu.) - He is fast.

example: ドアを閉めます。(Doa o shimemasu.) - I close the door.

when_to_say: Used when referring to opening something
example: 窓を開けます。(Mado o akemasu.) - I open the window.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a classroom
example: 教室は3階にあります。(Kyoushitsu wa sankai ni arimasu.) - The classroom is on the third floor.

when_to_say: Used when referring to school
example: 私は学校に行きます。(Watashi wa gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a company or workplace
example: 彼は会社に勤めています。(Kare wa kaisha ni tsutometeimasu.) - He works at a company.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a hospital
example: 病院はあそこです。(Byouin wa asoko desu.) - The hospital is over there.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a shop or store
example: この店は人気があります。(Kono mise wa ninki ga arimasu.) - This store is popular.

when_to_say: Used when referring to money
example: お金が足りません。(Okane ga tarimasen.) - I don't have enough money.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a phone
example: 電話をかけます。(Denwa o kakemasu.) - I make a phone call.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a letter
example: 友達に手紙を書きます。(Tomodachi ni tegami o kakimasu.) - I write a letter to my friend.

when_to_say: Used when referring to an airport
example: 空港に着きました。(Kuukou ni tsukimashita.) - I arrived at the airport.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a bank
example: 銀行でお金をおろします。(Ginkou de okane o oroshimasu.) - I withdraw money at the bank.

when_to_say: Used when referring to driving
example: 車を運転します。(Kuruma o untenshimasu.) - I drive a car.

when_to_say: Used when referring to speaking or talking
example: 日本語を話します。(Nihongo o hanashimasu.) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to listening to something
example: 音楽を聴きます。(Ongaku o kikimasu.) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to using something
example: パソコンを使います。(Pasokon o tsukaimasu.) - I use a computer.

when_to_say: Used when referring to buying something
example: 本を買います。(Hon o kaimasu.) - I buy a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to selling something
example: 果物を売ります。(Kudamono o urimasu.) - I sell fruits.

when_to_say: Used when referring to opening something like a door or book
example: ドアを開けます。(Doa o akemasu.) - I open the door.

when_to_say: Used when referring to closing something like a door or book
example: 本を閉じます。(Hon o tojimasu.) - I close the book.

when_to_say: Used when suggesting or recommending something
example: この本を勧めます。(Kono hon o susumemasu.) - I recommend this book.

when_to_say: Used when solving or resolving something
example: 問題を解決します。(Mondai o kaiketsu shimasu.) - I will solve the problem.

when_to_say: Used when returning to a previous position or state
example: ここに戻ります。(Koko ni modorimasu.) - I will return here.

when_to_say: Used when continuing something
example: 勉強を続けます。(Benkyou o tsuzukemasu.) - I will continue studying.

when_to_say: Used when finishing or ending something
example: 授業が終わります。(Jugyou ga owarimasu.) - The class finishes.

when_to_say: Used when starting something
example: 授業を始めます。(Jugyou o hajimemasu.) - I start the class.

when_to_say: Used when running around or moving quickly
example: 公園を走り回ります。(Kouen o hashirimawari masu.) - I run around the park.

when_to_say: Used when placing or putting something somewhere
example: テーブルに本を置きます。(Teeburu ni hon o okimasu.) - I put the book on the table.

when_to_say: Used when picking up something from the ground
example: ゴミを拾います。(Gomi o hiroimasu.) - I pick up the trash.

when_to_say: Used when discarding something
example: ゴミを捨てます。(Gomi o sutemasu.) - I throw away the trash.

when_to_say: Used when referring to walking
example: 毎日公園を歩きます。(Mainichi kouen o arukimasu.) - I walk in the park every day.

when_to_say: Used when sending something to someone
example: 手紙を送ります。(Tegami o okurimasu.) - I send a letter.

when_to_say: Used when shaking something
example: 手を振ります。(Te o furimasu.) - I wave my hand.

when_to_say: Used when waking someone up
example: 母を起こします。(Haha o okoshimasu.) - I wake up my mother.

when_to_say: Used to describe something frightening
example: その映画は怖いです。(Sono eiga wa kowai desu.) - That movie is scary.

when_to_say: Used to describe something enjoyable or fun
example: 昨日のパーティーは楽しかったです。(Kinou no paatii wa tanoshikatta desu.) - The party yesterday was fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is bright or cheerful
example: この部屋は明るいです。(Kono heya wa akarui desu.) - This room is bright.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is dark
example: 部屋が暗いです。(Heya ga kurai desu.) - The room is dark.

when_to_say: Used when expressing happiness or joy
example: プレゼントをもらって嬉しいです。(Purezento o moratte ureshii desu.) - I'm happy to receive a gift.

when_to_say: Used to describe feeling lonely or sad
example: 一人でいると寂しいです。(Hitori de iru to sabishii desu.) - I feel lonely when I'm alone.

when_to_say: Used when ensuring something is done completely or thoroughly
example: 仕事を徹底します。(Shigoto o tettei shimasu.) - I will carry out the work thoroughly.

when_to_say: Used when considering or giving thought to something
example: 意見を考慮します。(Iken o kouryo shimasu.) - I will consider the opinion.

when_to_say: Used when reaching a compromise
example: 私たちは妥協しました。(Watashitachi wa dakyou shimashita.) - We compromised.

when_to_say: Used when something reflects or mirrors another
example: 意見が反映されました。(Iken ga hanei saremashita.) - The opinion was reflected.

when_to_say: Used when something contradicts or is inconsistent
example: 彼の言っていることは矛盾しています。(Kare no itteiru koto wa mujun shiteimasu.) - What he is saying contradicts itself.

when_to_say: Used when investigating or determining something thoroughly
example: 真実を究明します。(Shinjitsu o kyuumei shimasu.) - I will investigate the truth.

when_to_say: Used when someone misunderstands something
example: 彼は私の言葉を誤解しました。(Kare wa watashi no kotoba o gokai shimashita.) - He misunderstood my words.

when_to_say: Used when assessing or evaluating something
example: 彼の成果を評価します。(Kare no seika o hyouka shimasu.) - I will evaluate his performance.

when_to_say: Used when agreeing with someone or something
example: 私はその意見に同意します。(Watashi wa sono iken ni doui shimasu.) - I agree with that opinion.

when_to_say: Used when something influences or affects something else
example: その出来事が私の考えに影響しました。(Sono dekigoto ga watashi no kangae ni eikyou shimashita.) - That event influenced my thinking.

when_to_say: Used when understanding or grasping a concept
example: 私はこの概念を把握しています。(Watashi wa kono gainen o haaku shiteimasu.) - I comprehend this concept.

when_to_say: Used when someone is confused or disoriented
example: 彼はその説明に混乱しました。(Kare wa sono setsumei ni konran shimashita.) - He was confused by that explanation.

when_to_say: Used to describe something done quickly or rapidly
example: 問題を迅速に解決しました。(Mondai o jinsoku ni kaiketsu shimashita.) - I solved the problem quickly.

when_to_say: Used when adjusting or adapting to something
example: 新しい環境に適応します。(Atarashii kankyou ni tekiou shimasu.) - I will adapt to the new environment.

when_to_say: Used when confronting or facing something difficult
example: 困難に立ち向かいます。(Konnan ni tachimukaimasu.) - I will face the challenge.

when_to_say: Used when referring to development or progress
example: このプロジェクトは順調に発展しています。(Kono purojekuto wa junchou ni hatten shiteimasu.) - This project is progressing smoothly.

when_to_say: Used when understanding something fully
example: その問題を理解しました。(Sono mondai o rikai shimashita.) - I understood the problem.

when_to_say: Used when considering or examining options
example: 新しい提案を検討します。(Atarashii teian o kentou shimasu.) - I will consider the new proposal.

when_to_say: Used when focusing or concentrating on something
example: 仕事に集中します。(Shigoto ni shuuchuu shimasu.) - I will concentrate on my work.

when_to_say: Used when making corrections or modifications
example: 誤りを修正します。(Ayamari o shūsei shimasu.) - I will correct the mistake.

when_to_say: Used when enhancing or making something stronger
example: チームの能力を強化します。(Chiimu no nouryoku o kyouka shimasu.) - I will strengthen the team's capabilities.

when_to_say: Used when making an assumption or guess
example: 結果を推測します。(Kekka o suisoku shimasu.) - I will guess the result.

when_to_say: Used when adjusting to a new situation
example: 新しい環境に適応します。(Atarashii kankyou ni tekiou shimasu.) - I will adapt to the new environment.

when_to_say: Used when trying something challenging
example: 新しいプロジェクトに挑戦します。(Atarashii purojekuto ni chousen shimasu.) - I will challenge myself with a new project.

when_to_say: Used when identifying or specifying something
example: 問題の原因を特定します。(Mondai no gen'in o tokutei shimasu.) - I will identify the cause of the problem.

when_to_say: Used when referring to utilizing a service or resource
example: インターネットを利用します。(Intānetto o riyou shimasu.) - I use the internet.

when_to_say: Used when stressing or emphasizing something
example: 重要な点を強調します。(Jūyō na ten o kyouchou shimasu.) - I emphasize the important point.

when_to_say: Used when examining or analyzing something in detail
example: データを分析します。(Dēta o bunseki shimasu.) - I will analyze the data.

when_to_say: Used when agreeing or coming to an understanding
example: 彼の説明に納得しました。(Kare no setsumei ni nattoku shimashita.) - I accepted his explanation.

when_to_say: Used when referring to making corrections or modifications
example: この修正は必要です。(Kono shuusei wa hitsuyou desu.) - This correction is necessary.

when_to_say: Used when announcing or presenting information
example: 新しい計画を発表します。(Atarashii keikaku o happyou shimasu.) - I will present the new plan.

when_to_say: Used when canceling or lifting a restriction
example: 契約を解除しました。(Keiyaku o kaijo shimashita.) - I canceled the contract.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a concept or idea
example: この概念は難しいです。(Kono gainen wa muzukashii desu.) - This concept is difficult.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a solution
example: 解決策を考えます。(Kaiketsusaku o kangaemasu.) - I will think of a solution.

when_to_say: Used when maintaining or preserving something
example: この状態を維持します。(Kono joutai o iji shimasu.) - I will maintain this condition.

when_to_say: Used to describe something significant or important
example: この情報は重要です。(Kono jouhou wa juuyou desu.) - This information is important.
